subject: Sorry for the noise ... (was RE: [junit] ClasspathWalker (even better))
msgSnippet: ... yesterday that I deleted a bunch without reading them. ... thread spawn into at least 3 other threads, ... I m sorry for what you consider noise. I guess I
messageBody:
> I bet it's related to a phenomenon I've been struck by the past day or
so:
>
> There have been so many posts to this email group between now and
yesterday that I deleted a bunch without reading them.
> Others may have done the same. Not to mention we've had one original
thread spawn into at least 3 other threads,
> which have been responsible for most of the traffic.

I'm sorry for what you consider noise. I guess I got involved in the
discussion, I thought it was (at times) useful. Since it was my first
posting (and heck, I was throttled by moderation) how was I to know that you
didn't want discuss on the list.

> I'd suggest some folks should think more between posts or take a
discussion offline until things are resolved,
> then come back with a summary. But this is so unusual for this list
(thinking over the past few years),
> it will probably return to normal soon by themselves.

I'd like to think I've been thinking, but hmm ... let me think about that
some more ... Yup, I'm pretty sure I was. You judge so harshly yet you admit
you deleted much of what was there. Couldn't you have just kept on deleting
and kept this to yourself? No, I guess you want a quiet mailing list. Ok,
you win -- I'm done.

Every other OSS list I know says discuss here, not in private, the
discussion is part of the process & best archived for reference. Clearly the
main two noise producers failed to come to a summary, so observation by
other was needed. A bunch of folks jumped in with what I considered
interesting perspectives, I was grateful for that, even if to you viewed it
as more noise.

> +1

-1 -- but hey, I clearly don't fit here. I thought I was discussing
something of small potential with the development team of junit, but I
clearly got that all wrong. I guess from that mistaken hypothesis all
conclusion is obviously worthless, so I should've just given up when I
thought about giving up.

I learned a lot from these threads, just little of it was about junit & most
of it was about this list's participants.

No more noise from me...

regards

Adam
